data.title: Principal Test Engineer
data.description:
Are you interested in being part of an innovative team that supports Westinghouse’s mission to provide clean energy solutions? At Westinghouse, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset and we seek to identify, attract and recruit the most qualified talent while recognizing and encouraging the value of diversity in the global workplace.

 Principal Test Engineer 

If this sounds like an environment you would thrive in, we have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Test Engineer. The selected candidate will work within the Advanced Reactor Testing group supporting research and development activities for the eVinci microreactor test program. The candidate will work primarily at the Waltz Mill site, with occasional travel to the Cranberry HQ and Churchill locations.

Your Day-to-Day

 Lead and execute test programs throughout all phases of the design process.  Collaborate with design teams to identify design features which require substantiation through testing.  Develop and implement design requirements, test plans, specifications, and procedures in accordance with quality assurance program requirements.  Collaborate with materials teams in design of high temperature / corrosion compatible test articles and in analyzation of test articles utilizing specialized mechanical / material analyses.  Actively coordinate with site environmental health and safety to design and implement safety protocols into experiments.  Perform and execute experiments in compliance with quality assurance and safety requirements.  Technical writing, including development of technical reports.  Reduce and analyze large data sets using Matlab, DIAdem, or Mathcad.  Design test articles and first of a kind prototypes utilizing standard engineering practices and finite element analysis.  Research, design, and selection of equipment and instrumentation for test facility applications.  Prepare detailed sketches, 3D models, and drawings using Auto Cad, Inventor, and/or Solidworks.  Develop control and data acquisition systems for instruments and equipment using Labview.  Hands-on fabrication and assembly of test fixtures and test equipment.  Hands-on installation and troubleshooting of instrumentation and equipment controls.  Integrate testing efforts with modeling and analysis efforts.  Develop and maintain effective business relationships with Westinghouse customers. 

Who You Are

As a successful candidate, you will bring the following to the team: 

 Bachelors in Mechanical, Electro-Mechanical, or Aerospace Engineering (Master’s or PhD degree preferred).  8+ years professional experience  Prior experience working in a lab/testing environment (academic or industry lab).  Prior experience and knowledge of laboratory chemical hygiene practices.  Mechanical problem-solving skills.  Strong organizational, planning skills, and attention to detail.  Highly motivated, self-starter.  Good judgment and the ability to prioritize a number of diverse tasks.  Orientation towards achieving Customer Success.  Effective communication, teaming, and team building skills.  Strong technical writing ability.  Knowledge of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T) practices including tolerance stackup analyses.  Knowledge of dimensional inspection standards and tooling.  Experience and knowledge of instrumentation error propagation analyses. Experience in 3D modeling and drafting software (Inventor or Solidworks).  Experience in thermal-structural design analysis considering material systems of varying thermal expansion.  Experience with finite element analysis utilizing ANSYS workbench.  Preferred pressure, temperature, and fluid flow instrumentation experience.  Preferred working knowledge of ASME Section VIII BPVC code.  Preferred working knowledge of NI Labview.  Preferred experience with ultra/high vacuum applications involving design and selection of pumping systems and materials at room and high temperature conditions. 

Why Westinghouse?

Westinghouse Electric Company Is The Global Nuclear Energy Industry’s First Choice For Safe, Clean, And Efficient Energy Solutions. We Enable Our Delivery Of This Vision By Living Our Value System

 Safety and Quality  Integrity and Trust  Customer Focus and Innovation  Speed and Passion to Win  Teamwork and Accountability 

Benefits

Westinghouse offers competitive benefits to all our employees around the globe to keep them healthy and enhance their well-being. In the U.S. the following are representative of what we offer:

 Competitive Salary  Comprehensive Health, Wellness and Income Protection Benefits  401(k) Savings Plan with Company Match  Paid Vacations and Holidays  Opportunities for Flexible Work Arrangements  Educational Reimbursement Program  Employee Referral Program 

While our Global Headquarters are located in Cranberry Township, PA, we have over 9,000 employees working at locations in 19 different countries. You can learn more by visiting http://www.westinghousenuclear.com .

EOE of Minorities / Females / Vets / Disability.

Get Connected With Westinghouse On Social Media

Twitter | Facebook | LinkedIn | YouTube

data.title: Senior Data Engineer
data.description:
Join our dynamic team as a Data Engineer. You'll spearhead transformative initiatives within our software solution company, which is dedicated to revolutionizing the insurance industry. In this pivotal role, you'll collaborate closely with insurance sector stakeholders to craft data strategies harmonizing with business objectives, ensuring alignment and effectiveness. Your expertise will shine as you architect robust data frameworks, meticulously balancing scalability, security, and peak performance across diverse cloud environments.

Important Notes This job is not open to any third-party companies or your candidates We can't offer sponsorship now or in the futureYou will work in a hybrid work environment Direct Hire with a bonus, 401K, PTO, and full benefits 
We're seeking someone well-versed in Azure data solutions, with a deep understanding of Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure Cache for Redis, Snowflake and Azure PostgreSQL, explicitly tailored to insurance needs. Your knack for leveraging cloud-native services will be instrumental as you streamline data storage, processing, and analytics, driving efficiency and reliability throughout our systems. 
Your responsibilities extend to implementing seamless data integration solutions and facilitating the fluid movement of information within our organization, with a laser focus on insurance-specific data intricacies. Upholding data integrity is paramount, and you'll ensure the efficiency, reliability, and security of our data integration processes, implementing stringent measures to safeguard sensitive insurance data assets. 
As a Data Engineer, you'll continually optimize data architectures to enhance performance and scalability, tackling the unique challenges presented by the insurance landscape head-on. These challenges require your expertise, such as managing large volumes of complex data and ensuring data security in a highly regulated industry. Your solutions will accommodate burgeoning data volumes and evolving user demands within our innovative insurance software platforms. Moreover, you'll champion data governance, establishing and enforcing policies and practices tailored precisely to the insurance domain, guaranteeing compliance and impeccable data quality organization-wide. 
Collaboration is not just a buzzword for us; it's at the heart of our success. As a Data Engineer, you'll thrive in this role by working closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders. Your ability to grasp requirements and offer expert technical guidance, particularly in insurance-specific contexts, will be instrumental in driving our projects forward. We value your input and believe that the best solutions are born out of teamwork. 
We're looking for candidates with a relevant degree in Computer Science or a related field and a solid understanding of the insurance industry. Your hands-on experience of at least five years with cloud providers is crucial, as is proficiency in SQL, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Redis, Snowflake and ETL methodologies. Experience with public cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is highly valued, and a comprehensive grasp of data warehousing, big data, and data lake concepts is explicitly tailored to insurance challenges and opportunities. If you're passionate about driving innovation in the insurance sector through cutting-edge data solutions, we want to hear from you! 


Desired Skills and Experience

SQL, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, Redis, Snowflake, ETL, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
